noun.description: A word, letter, or number placed before another.
examples: add the prefix 83 to the extension number

verb.description: Add (something) at the beginning as a prefix or introduction.
examples: a preface is prefixed to the book

origin: Mid 16th century (as a verb): from Old French prefixer, from Latin praefixus fixed in front, from the verb praefigere, from prae before + figere to fix. The noun is from modern Latin praefixum, neuter (used as a noun) of praefixus, and dates from the mid 17th century.
